this is one lesson that we try to
enforce reinforce every year is that as
benign as it may seem but one should not
just simply rename metrics because this
is a breaking change why this is a
breaking change is because when you
rename a metric you're deleting the old
metric and you're replacing that with a
brand new one so all of your existing
monitoring the alerts the dashboards
that were using the old metric they
would now stop working this is a
realization that came to us after
numerous breakages that had happened uh
for Kubernetes metrics in the past which
gave rise to the Kubernetes metrics
framework as a part of this effort uh we
wrapped the Prometheus client libraries
implementation with our own uh
implementations for metrics and we added
an annotation for the metrics uh to
denote the stability level for them the
stability level is a way for us to
express the likelihood of that metric

uh also with this framework we uh it

where we can easily convert Kubernetes

for example pods and nodes and it makes

line as a whole uh it also conform to
